text: suggested him to spray rogor@2ml/lit.at evening time.

suggested him to apply fertilizer in recommended dose like urea-600gm,ssp-1kg,mop-700gm,borax-25gm twice in a year(march/april and september/october)followed by trench method and also suggested him to spray planofix@1teaspoonful per20-25 liter of water.
suggested to consult with officer-marketing and recovery (rural),sbi local branch for details.
suggested to take early ahu rice variety from atic,jorhat,aau campus through parcel or direct taking.
suggested him to aplly recommended fertilizer dose-urea@1.5 kg,ssp@2.5kg,mop@1.75 kg,borax@25 gm./plant/year in trench method.
given details about induced breeding of fishes.
suggested to approach district agricultural officer  or atic,jorhat,ph (0376)2310240
suggested to provide mineral mixture like ranmix total, milkmin, gwala etc at recommanded dose along with feed.also, suggested to feed high protienous green fodder like cowpea, berseem, lucern etc.
suggested to apply bordeaux mixture. apply borax @ 50 gm/plant per year along with urea & ssp.
suggested  preservatives  are: 1. benjoic acid &  2.  sulphar  dioxide . these chemicals re used to preserve for severel weeks.
suggested herbicide- butachlor ( machete ) which is a  pre-emergence weedicide.
suggested to apply dithane m- 45 @ 2-3ml/litre of water and also to check irrigation water supply in the field.

suggested that he should go for the single species culture in one pond or he can culture some other species along with chitala, but in the second case, size of other species should be larger than chitala .
suggested suitable early ahu varieties are as saket-4, ir-50, govind, ir-36, cauvery, krishna, jaya, ir-8, luit, kopilee.
suggested fym or compost requirement for blackgram crops as 6 quintql/bigha, this not only adds fertility but also improves soil structures.
suggested to contact with  central agricultural university , mizoram for availibility of quail  birds
suggested to apply 100 ppm agromycine or streptomycine twice in a week and also to avoid water stagnation in the field.
suggested to contact deshbandhu club which is situated in cachar district
suggested to either spray planofix @ 1ml/4litre of water or apply borax @ 200 g/plant at the base of the tree by making ring .
suggested that the seeds of maize should be treated with  bavistin @ 2 g/ kg of seeds or captaf @ 2- 2.5 g /kg of seeds before or after sowing.

suggested to apply lime @ 1000 kg/ hac/yr. one third of the required dose is to be applied  at the time of pond preparation & the remaining portion is to be applied in equal monthly installment. he is also suggested to maintain the water quality properly.
suggested him to apply cow dung manure @7kg/plant at the base of the plant and spray planofix @2ml/litre of water at 15 days interval.
suggested him that pumkin can be grown in two season i.e january to april for summer hervest and september to november for spring hervest.
suggested him to apply malathion 5%dust @2 g/plant in case of soil application.also suggested him to keep the crops field weeds free to further arrest the pest infestation.
suggested to apply 1500 g urea, 2500 g ssp and 1750 g mop per plant along with  50 g borax.
suggested to apply bordeaux mixture
suggested to apply rogor@1 ml/litre of water
suggested to apply 250 gm urea ,700 gm ssp and 200 gm mop and 5 kg fym.spacing 2mt*2mt.

suggested to apply 8 kg of urea,46 kg of single super,24 kg of potash along with 300 kg of fym as basal dressing for a land of 1 bigha. 4 kg 0f urea to be top dressed at flowering stage and again 4 kg 0f urea to be top dressed at fruit set.
suggested to apply malathion 50 ec @1 ml/2.5 litres water + molasses @10 gm /litre water
suggested to apply znso4 (5 kg) and lime (2.5 kg) in 1000 litres water after 10 days of sowing
suggested to castrat within 1-1and 1/2 months.
early kuwari,pusa deepali

suggested mr.hajam to apply 8kg of urea,33kg of ssp,14kg of mop along with 300kg of fym.this fertiliser dose suggested is for 1 bigha of land.

suggested mr.koiri to drench the soil at the base of the plant with 100ppm of streptomycin. also suggested to apply a mixture of 1 gram asafoetida along with 5 gram of turmeric powder in 10 litres of water and to drench the soil 3 times at an interval of 15,30 and 45 days after transplanting.

suggested mr.koiri to cut into pieces longitudinally,the bigger sized tubers having 2-3 eyes in each piece and then to dip the cut pieces in mancozeb @ 5 gram in 1 litre of water for about 10 mins. after that ,the seeds are to be spread thinly and dried under shade for 48 hours or should be covered with moist gunny bags for 2-3 days for suberization.

suggested the following: boro-1,boro-2,culture-1,krishna,ir-50,cauvery,banglami,bishnuprasad and jyotiprasad. these suggested varieties are best suited for his barak valley zone from where he belongs and all these varieties can be planted in december/january.

suggested mr. borbhuyan to dip the selected tubers (to be sown) in a solution of 30 gram boric acid and 1 litre of water for 30 minutes. after that the tubers are to be thinly spread in shade. also suggested to examine the tuber seeds and to separate and throw away the rotten ones and whenever such cases are observed, advised to spary malathion 5 percent dust powder with the help of a sprayer for which 200 gram of malathion 5 percent dust powder is sufficient for 1 quintal of potato tubers.

replied that the three numbers of irrigations has to be adopted. ist at 25 days (stolon formation stage) , 2nd at 60 days ( tuber formation stage) and the 3rd irrigation at 80 days ( tuber development stage). also replied that in case of mulching materials in furrows, only two numbers of irrigation has to be adopted . one at 25 days and the other at 60 days.
